card_game_24

Class CardGame24GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • card_game_24.CardGame24GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class CardGame24GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class is the Main GUI for the 24 Card Game Project, for my Java 143 class (Spr2016). The purpose of this project is to create an application which allows users to arrange a draw of four cards into an arithmetic expression which evaluates to 24. Project: 24 Card Game Platform: jdk 1.8.0_14; NetBeans IDE 8.1; Windows 10 Course: CS 143 Created on May 23, 2016, 5:10 PM Revised on May 23, 2016, PM
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • readPlayersFromFile

        private java.util.ArrayList<Player> readPlayersFromFile()
        Reads all of our Players information from an XML File, as arrays of Strings, then feeds each String[] to the Player's array constructor to create an ArrayList of Player objects.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Player objects.

      • displayCards

        private void displayCards()
        Displays the four cards currently in play on the main displayPanel. Resets the redundancy validator with the current had being displayed.

      • displayUserStats

        private void displayUserStats()
        Displays the basic user statistics on the right hand side of the main GUI. There are not the comprehensive statistics that may be accessed via the game menu, these are much more basic.

      • selectPlayer

        private Player selectPlayer()
        Spawns a JDialog which allows the user to select a User out of all existing players so that the application may track their stats under this username.
        Returns:
        Player object which will be the subject of the game.

      • savePlayers

        private void savePlayers()
        Saves the Statistics of every player as long as the current player is not using the Guest Account.

      • writePlayersToFile

        private void writePlayersToFile(java.lang.String file,
                                java.util.ArrayList arraylist)
        Writes the ArrayList `players` to an XML Database.
        Parameters:
        file - The file path of the XML Database we will save our Players information to.
        arraylist - the ArrayList of the players we wish to save.

      • validNumsInExpression

        private boolean validNumsInExpression(java.lang.String express)
        Determines whether the numbers entered in our expression matches the numbers which were drawn in the hand.
        Parameters:
        express - The expression we are validating.
        Returns:
        True if the numbers used in the expression are valid.

      • linearPlayerSearch

        private int linearPlayerSearch(java.lang.String playerName)
        Searches for a player whom contains the given name, then returns the index at which they are found.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player which we are searching for.
        Returns:
        The index at which they are found.

      • expressionButtonActionPerformed

        private void expressionButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Evaluates an expression, determines whether it is valid or redundant. If it is unique and valid then the current score and the player's score is incremented. If the current score is larger that the player's high score, the high score is updated.
        Parameters:
        evt -
